definition: to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste

sentences.english: The monarch was ousted by a military coup.
sentences.chinese: 那君主被军事政变者废黜了。

sentences.english: Like a king in exile, uncrowned in the underworld.
sentences.chinese: 像流放中的君王，被废黜到地狱。

sentences.english: The emperor attempted to depose the Pope.
How some have been deposed, some slain in war.
sentences.chinese: 有些被废黜，有些战死沙场。

sentences.english: The king was deposed by the revolution.
Tennessee's rescinded manual appeared to confuse lethal injection with electrocution.
sentences.chinese: 田纳西废黜的手册似乎是将致命注射和电刑混为一谈。

sentences.english: Mr. Thaksin was ousted in a military coup in 2006.
sentences.chinese: 他信在2006年的一次军事政变中被废黜。

sentences.english: And disestablishment would be a very good thing.
sentences.chinese: 第二，废黜英国国教应该会是一件极好的事情。

definition: to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
to confer a title on (an empress or a prince)
to commit suicide on the orders of a sovereign (old)
to hand down an imperial edict
an execution/to put sb to death
